title: 1234ab

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Any multiple of 11 can be found by taking the sum of the 1st, 3rd, 5th, etc numbers in the number and subtracting the sum of the 2nd, 4th, 6th, etc numbers.  The difference must be 0 or a multiple of 11."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The sum of all the numbers must be a multiple of 9.  The first 4 add to 10 so a+b must be either 8 or 17 to meet this condition making the sum of all 6 numbers 18 or 27."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Considering the first conditions... (a+4) - (b+6) = 0 since the highest possible positive number made with this equation is 7 and the lowest is -11, where for (a+4) - (b+6) = -11 a = 0 and b = 9... This makes the sum of each number in 1234ab 19 which is not a multiple of 9."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a - b) + (4 - 6) = 0
a - b - 2 = 0
a - b = 2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know the difference between a and b to be 2.  The sum of 9 and 7 is 16 so their sum must be 8 and not 17."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a + b = 8
a - b = 2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 8 - b"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(8 - b) - b = 2
-2b = -6
b = 3"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a - 3 = 2 
a = 5"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So ab is 53."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A number is a multiple of 9 and 11 means it is divisible by 9 and 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So,a fast way to know a multiple 9 is sum all the digits if the total is divisible by 9 means the original number is also divisible by 9."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number 1234ab has to total up to 18 or 27 to be divisible by 9 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we have narrow down our solutions to 1234ab where ab is 17, 26, 35, 44, 53, 62, 72, 89, 98"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now to look for a multiple of 11, add the digits in blocks of 2 from the right to left "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For eg : 17 + 34 + 12 = 63 ( not multiple of 11 )"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"53 + 34 + 12 = 99 ( a multiple of 11 and 9 )"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, our answer is 53..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            1234ab is both divisible by 9 and 11 and both are coprimed numbers"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so 1234ab is divisible by 9x11=99"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence 1234ab = 1247x99 - 53 + 10a+ b"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so 10a + b - 53 is divisible by 99 --> 10a + b - 53 = 99n"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence 10a + b <= 99 --> n = 0 --> 10a + b = 53 = ab

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I also solved it the same way but this seems like hit and trial any other solutions?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We begin by giving a random value to a and b, say "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore if we divide 123400 by 11:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{123400}{11}=11218 + \frac{2}{11}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\longrightarrow"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123400=11218\cdot 11 + 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123398=11218\cdot 11 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"we know 123398 is a multiple of 11, so every time we add 11 to it, it will be a multiple of 11 as well"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\longrightarrow"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123398=11\cdot x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\longrightarrow"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123398+11=11\cdot x\ +11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\longrightarrow"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123398+11=11\cdot( x+1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so if we keep adding 11 to 123398 we will end up with a number which is a multiple of 9."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If it is a multiple of 9, it will be a multiple of 3, therefore the sum of their digits will be a multiple of three too"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-123398+11=123409 (1+2+3+4+0+9=19)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" NOT A MULTIPLE OF 3"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-123409+11=123420 (1+2+3+4+2+0=12)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" A MULTIPLE OF 3 BUT NOT 9"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-123420+11=123431(1+2+3+4+3+1=14)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" NOT A MULTIPLE OF 3"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-123431+11=123442(1+2+3+4+4+2=16)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" NOT A MULTIPLE OF 3"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-123442+11=123453(1+2+3+4+4+2=18)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" VUOLA !!)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Answer =123453"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"divisiblity test for 9:-
sub of digits divisiblle by 9 and
divisibility test for 11:-
A number passes the test for 11 if the difference of the sums of alternating digits is divisible by 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so
1+2+3+4+a+b should be divisile by 9
(1+3+a)-(2+4+b) should be divisible by 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10+a+b by 9
-2+a-b by 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"putting a=5 b=3
satisfies answer"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            for the number to be divisible by 11, (sum of the digits of odd places) - (sum of the digits of even places) =0
So, (1+3+a)=(2+4+b)  This gives us  the first equation  a-b=2
For the number to be divisible by 9, the sum of the digits must equal to a number divisible by 9.
We know that 1+2+3+4=10
So,  a+b=8  or a+b=17   because 10+8=18 (divisible by 9) and 10+17=27(divisible by 9)
So, now we have two system of equations to be solved:
First system:   a-b=2  , a+b=17
Or, Second system: a-b=2, a+b=8
if you solve the first system you get b=7.5  rejected
if you solve the second system you get a=5 and b=3
So ab is 53

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 1234 Followers. A problem for "1234"
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/98a8dca25a.965dc94225.BLaVYF.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
If the total number of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-digit positive integers that can be formed using the digits "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  inclusive and without repetition. such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{1234}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" always exist collectively in the same order in the positive integer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We coin the term: "},{"type":"text","text":"Cute divisors","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":". A cute divisor of a number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a positive integer other than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which divide the number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" completely and leaves no remainder."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all "},{"type":"text","text":"cute  divisors","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1234"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must exist contiguously, we can consider them as a single digit "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since the original number is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit, the number now reduces to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit numbers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A_4A_3A_2A_1A_0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that can be formed using digits "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\{0, A, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9\}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total ways to place these "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits in a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit number, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N(T)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=7 \times 6 \times 5 \times 4 \times 3 = 2520"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit numbers that had "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N(Z)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 1 \times 6 \times 5 \times 4 \times 3 = 360"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit numbers that did not have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N(\overline{A})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 6 \times 5 \times 4 \times 3 \times 2 = 720"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit numbers that did not have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and had "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N(\overline{A} \cap Z)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 1 \times 5 \times 4 \times 3 \times 2 = 120"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Total valid "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit numbers that have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= N(T) - N(Z) - N(\overline{A}) + N(\overline{A} \cap Z)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 2520 - 360  - 720 + 120"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 1560"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Prime factorization of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = 2^3 \times 3 \times 5 \times 13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = \frac{2^4-1}{2-1} \times (3 + 1) \times (5+1) \times (13 + 1) = 5040"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of cute divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = 5040 - 1 - 1560 = 3479"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hey Sandeep! I checked on the internet and it says that 1 is also  considered a proper divisor. I thought you meant the sum of proper divisors excluding one and I subtracted 1 when I entered 3480 and it said that it was wrong. 
The solution is simple enough:
1234 can be considered a block occupying one space and the other digits occupying one space each. This reduces it to a sort of 5 digit problem. 0 should not occupy the first place and we don't have to worry about this when the 1234 block occupies the 1st place. We then get:
(5!×5×4+6!)/2=1560=8×3×5×13.
Sum of divisors of 1560=5040.
Sum of proper divisors (excluding 1) = 3479."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Since 1234 always remain together, they can be considered as a single unit. Hence the number may look like any of the following
                                       (i) 1234 _ _ _ _     (ii) _ 1234 _ _ _                        (iii) _ _ 1234 _ _     (iv) _ _ _ 1234 _    (v) _ _ _ _ 1234 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
In the first choice we have (6×5×4×3)  cases, in the rest of the choices, 0 can't be in the first position, hence number of cases in each choice (5×5×4×3) , so total number of cases (360 + 4*300=1560)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}
